results.title: Atenolol induced memory impairment: a case report.

citations.NLM: Ramanathan M. Atenolol induced memory impairment: a case report. Singapore Med J. 1996 Apr;37(2):218-9. PMID: 8942269
citations.BibTeX: @article{8942269, title={Atenolol induced memory impairment: a case report.}, author={Ramanathan M}, journal={Singapore Med J}, volume={37}, number={2}, pages={218-9}}

results.title: Effect of aging on atenolol pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics.
results.text_hl: These data suggest that group differences in @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ pharmacokinetics were likely a result of @<m>DISEASE_Memory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008569 @@@age-related decline in renal function@@@, and that the elderly subjects were at least as sensitive as, and maybe even more sensitive than, the younger subjects to the negative chronotropic effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Sowinski KM, Forrest A, Wilton JH, Taylor AM 2nd, Wilson MF, Kazierad DJ. Effect of aging on atenolol pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics. J Clin Pharmacol. 1995 Aug;35(8):807-14. PMID: 8522638
citations.BibTeX: @article{8522638, title={Effect of aging on atenolol pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics.}, author={Sowinski KM and Forrest A and Wilton JH and Taylor AM 2nd and Wilson MF and Kazierad DJ}, journal={J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={35}, number={8}, pages={807-14}}

results.title: Influence of beta-adrenoceptor agonists and antagonists on baclofen-induced memory impairment in mice.
results.text_hl: The administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (a @GENE_HBB_B1 @GENE_15129 @@@beta 1@@@-antagonist) or @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (a beta-antagonist) produced a @<m>DISEASE_Memory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008569 @@@memory impairment@@@.

citations.NLM: Zarrindast MR, Haidari H, Jafari MR, Djahanguiri B. Influence of beta-adrenoceptor agonists and antagonists on baclofen-induced memory impairment in mice. Behav Pharmacol. 2004 Jul;15(4):293-7. PMID: 15252280
citations.BibTeX: @article{15252280, title={Influence of beta-adrenoceptor agonists and antagonists on baclofen-induced memory impairment in mice.}, author={Zarrindast MR and Haidari H and Jafari MR and Djahanguiri B}, journal={Behav Pharmacol}, volume={15}, number={4}, pages={293-7}}

results.title: Memory function--effects of different antihypertensive drugs.
results.text_hl: The study indicated that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ might produce mild @<m>DISEASE_Memory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008569 @@@memory impairment@@@, whereas @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ was devoid of any measurable effect on memory function.

citations.NLM: Richardson PJ, Wyke MA. Memory function--effects of different antihypertensive drugs. Drugs. 1988;35 Suppl 5():80-5. PMID: 3063488
citations.BibTeX: @article{3063488, title={Memory function--effects of different antihypertensive drugs.}, author={Richardson PJ and Wyke MA}, journal={Drugs}, volume={35 Suppl 5}, pages={80-5}}

results.title: Glucocorticoid effects on memory retrieval require concurrent noradrenergic activity in the hippocampus and basolateral amygdala.
results.text_hl: Pretest infusions of the @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1-adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ into either the hippocampus (1.25 microg in 0.5 microl) or the BLA (0.5 microg in 0.2 microl) also prevented the @GENE_NR3C1 @GENE_24413 @@@GR@@@ agonist-induced @<m>DISEASE_Memory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D008569 @@@memory retrieval impairment@@@.

citations.NLM: Roozendaal B, Hahn EL, Nathan SV, de Quervain DJ, McGaugh JL. Glucocorticoid effects on memory retrieval require concurrent noradrenergic activity in the hippocampus and basolateral amygdala. J Neurosci. 2004 Sep 15;24(37):8161-9. PMID: 15371517
citations.BibTeX: @article{15371517, title={Glucocorticoid effects on memory retrieval require concurrent noradrenergic activity in the hippocampus and basolateral amygdala.}, author={Roozendaal B and Hahn EL and Nathan SV and de Quervain DJ and McGaugh JL}, journal={J Neurosci}, volume={24}, number={37}, pages={8161-9}}
